Who is the Volunteer Economy?

The Volunteer Economy is a 501c3 charity created by serial entrepreneur and founder, Paul Shirley, in 2009. The WAVE charity financially sponsors the WAVE Commons, a non-profit member-owned collaborative that gives individuals from all walks of life the opportunity to put their unique gifts to work by connecting them with a broad range of volunteer opportunities.

Free Tuition & Fees for Volunteer Members Who Qualify

Our Mission

Provide timely and affordable access to education, healthcare & economic opportunities for volunteers.

Provide opportunities to serve & be served for the well-being of our environment, health, education, economy & social justice.

Get Involved

Donating to The Volunteer Economy helps grow the program to other communities and launch new innovative tools and applications.

Short History

Serving and Sharing for the Common Good

  1. Paul Shirley starts The World Alliance for the Volunteer Economy (WAVE)

    2009

  2. The WAVE charity financially sponsors the WAVE Commons, a non-profit member-owned collaborative

    2009

  3. The Volunteer Economy launches first release of web and mobile applications.

    August 2018

Support

Get Involved

Donating to The Volunteer Economy helps grow the program to other communities and launch new innovative tools and applications. Your donations will go towards aiding suffering veterans and the poor of the world and helping them meet their basic needs (safety, security, food, clothing, shelter, light, air & water) and advanced needs (healthcare, education, jobs, new venture creation, etc.).
